p.s: In the given extract from Act II scene 2 from William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet Romeo surprises Juliet at her place in the middle of the night.
It is the famous balcony scene where they confess their love for each other.
Nevertheless, Juliet is concerned about Romeo showing up.
When Romeo comeso ut of hiding Juliet immediately recognizes his voice but is concerned about the danger that any of the Capulet kinsmen might find and kill him.
Romeo on the other hand is not scared of them and insists that his love is so strong that no one can stop him.
If only she likes him too, her love will protect him.
Furthermore, he takes her worries and explains that the darkness of the night covers him.
Nevertheless, he states that he wants the kinsmen to find and kill him if Juliet does not love him back.
Further in the scene, Juliet is concerned about wetherwhether or not Romeo truly loves her or if their love is evolving totoo quickly.
Questioning his love and her behavior she wants Romeo to give her his honest word and promise that his love is truthful.
Overall, Juliet is concerned about Romeo's life that is in danger whereas he tries to take her fear away and states that the danger of her not loving him back is greater than his death.
Therefore, both want the validation of the other concerning their love.
